p: Ferulago angulata known as Chavir (Azarbani et al., 2014) is a native plant in some parts of Iran (Sodeifian et al., 2011). The genus Ferulago belongs to the Apiaceae family and is used in folk medicine for sedative, tonic, digestive, and antiparasitic effects (Taran et al., 2010). There have been some published reports on its significant antibacterial, antioxidant, and antidiabetic properties, and, traditionally, it was added to dairy and oil ghee to prevent decay as a strong preservative and to increase the shelf life of dairy products besides adding a pleasant taste to them (Alizadeh et al., 2019; Azarbani et al., 2014).
